intro: Alloplectus sprucei, commonly known as the spruceleaf spurge, is a flowering plant belonging to the Euphorbiaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of North America, particularly in the western United States and southern Canada. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are usually lance-shaped and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Its flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences, and it produces a milky latex when the stems or leaves are broken. Alloplectus sprucei typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open woodlands or alpine meadows.
